document.docAuthor: Kim, Il-Hoi, Sikorski, Andrey, O’Reilly, Myles & Boxshall, Geoff A.
document.masterDocTitle: Copepods associated with polychaete worms in European seas

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Copepods associated with polychaete worms in European seas

bibRefCitation.author: Gotto, R. V.
bibRefCitation.refString: Gotto, R. V. (1964) The Anomoclausiidae: a new family of cyclopoid copepods, with a description of Anomoclausia indrehusae gen. nov., sp. nov. Crustaceana, 6, 220 - 228. http: // dx. doi. org / 10.1163 / 156854064 X 00614

subSubSection.paragraph:

gas and condensate field, Stn 2-3 ( 61.076ºN , 2.504ºE ), depth
189 m
,
01 June 2005
; BMNH Reg. No. 2012.1361
.

.

Remarks. The original description of
A. indrehusae
is partly revised in the above redescription, especially the form and setation of the antennule, antenna, maxilla and maxilliped. In addition, the conical posteromedian protuberance of leg 1, mentioned by Gotto (1964) , is apparently the inner protopodal spine that is usually found in members of the family Clausidiidae .

Gotto (1964) speculated that spionid polychaetes might be the most likely hosts of
A. indrehusae
. The multiple records here from the spionid
Pseudopolydora paucibranchiata
confirm his suspicions.
